lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `wenjiebot/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

* The Ui class handles interactions with the user, including displaying messages and reading input.
* It provides methods to show welcome and farewell messages, display lines for formatting,
* show error messages, and read user commands.
* Displays a welcome message to the user.
* This message is shown when the bot is first started.
String greeting = "Eh wassup la bro, my name is Wen Jie.\n What you want?";
* Displays a farewell message to the user.
* This message is shown when the bot is about to exit.
String farewell = "Paiseh bro I zao liao, see you around ah bro.";
* Displays a line for formatting output.
* This line is used to separate different sections of output for clarity.
* Displays an error message to the user.
* This method is used to inform the user of any errors that occur during execution.
* @param errorMessage the error message to be displayed.
* Reads a command input from the user.
* This method waits for the user to enter a command and returns it as a string.
* @param scanner the Scanner object used to read input from the user.
* @return the command entered by the user as a string.
* The WenJie class represents the main application for the wenjiebot individual project.
* It initializes the user interface, storage, and task list, and controls
* the execution flow of the bot by processing user commands.
* Constructs a WenJie instance with the specified file path for storage.
* Initializes the user interface, storage, and task list.
* @param filePath The path to the file where tasks are stored.
* Starts the WenJie application, displaying a welcome message and
* continuously processing user commands until the exit condition is met.
* Handles any WenJieException that occurs during command execution.
* The main entry point of the WenJie application.
* Creates a WenJie instance with the specified file path and starts the application.
* Generates a response for the user's chat message.

* Abstract class representing a command in Wenjie chatbot.
* Commands are used to perform various actions such as adding tasks, listing tasks, etc.
* This class provides the basic structure for commands including whether the command
* should exit the application and the input associated with the command.
* Constructs a Command with the specified exit status and input.
* @param isExit boolean indicating whether this command will exit the application.
* @param input the input associated with this command.
* Executes the command. The implementation of this method is specific to each subclass.
* @param tasks the TaskList that contains all the tasks.
* @param ui the Ui used for interaction with the user.
* @param storage the Storage used to store and retrieve tasks.
* @throws WenJieException if there is an error during execution.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws WenJieException;

* Represents an exception that is thrown when the user provides invalid input.
* This exception provides a custom error message to guide the user in correcting
* the format for event or deadline tasks.
* Constructs an InvalidDateInputException with a default error message.
* Returns a custom error message that provides instructions to the user
* on the correct input format for event or deadline tasks.
return "eh paiseh ah bro, you need to tell me your start time and end time \n "
* Represents an exception that is thrown when the required file cannot be found.
* This exception provides a custom error message to indicate that the file is missing.
* Constructs a NoFileException with a default error message.
* Returns a custom error message that indicates the file is missing.
return "eh siao liao, I can't find the file to put my lobang in sia";
* Represents an exception that is thrown when the user fails to follow up with a task
* after a command. This exception provides a custom error message to guide the user
* in providing a task along with their command.
* Constructs a NoFollowUpException with a default error message.
* Returns a custom error message that instructs the user to include a task
* with their command in the correct format.
return "eh paiseh ah bro, you need to tell me one task along with your \n "
+ "command in this format 'todo/event/deadline *insert your task here*'";
* Represents an exception that is thrown when the user does not provide a number
* after a mark, unmark, or delete command. This exception provides a custom error
* message to remind the user to include a number with these commands.
* Constructs a NoNumberInputtedException with a default error message.
* Returns a custom error message that instructs the user to include a number
* after the mark, unmark, or delete command.
return "wah shag bro, you forgot to add a number after your mark/unmark/delete command";
* Represents an exception that is thrown when the user inputs a list number
* that exceeds the current bounds of the list. This exception provides a custom
* error message to notify the user about the invalid list number.
* Constructs an OutOfBoundsException with a default error message.
* Returns a custom error message that informs the user they have input
* a list number that has not yet been added to the list.
return "wah shag bro, you input a list number that hasn't been added to the list yet";
* Represents an exception that is thrown when the user inputs an unrecognized command.
* This exception provides a custom error message to inform the user about the valid commands.
* Constructs an UnknownCommandException with a default error message.
* Returns a custom error message that lists the valid commands the bot can execute.

* The Deadline class represents a deadline task in the wenjiebot application.
* It extends the Task class and includes additional information for the deadline,

* The format includes the type of task, description, and due date and time,
* formatted as "EEE, dd MMM yyyy HH:mm".
* @return A string representation of the Deadline for display.
DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("EEE, dd MMM yyyy HH:mm");
